cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 195 mi SW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north toward Florida’s Big Bend, then forecast to turn north-northeast and track along/near the coasts of Georgia and South Carolina before emerging into the Atlantic and accelerating east-northeast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Mouth of the St. Mary’s River (FL/GA border) to Edisto Beach, SC; Storm Surge Watch from Mouth of the St. Mary’s River to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Sebastian Inlet, FL northward to Surf City, NC (includes entire South Carolina coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend, entire Georgia coast, South Carolina coast including Charleston, and portions of the North Carolina coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds (34–50 kt) are likely; a brief period of hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out if Idalia remains strong while passing nearby Wednesday night–early Thursday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible in Charleston Harbor and adjacent coastal areas.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher amounts could cause flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Wednesday into Thursday; dangerous rip currents and rough seas impacting vessel operations.
